fields.description:
Recently I had seen, there are so many jira's for fixing the typo's ( Keep on accumulating more ). Hence I want to plan in proper manner such that everything will be addressed..

I am thinking, we can fix project level ( at most package level)...

My intention to avoid the number of jira's on typo's...One more suggestion to reviewer's is please dn't commit for class level try to check project level ( atmost package level) if any such typo's present...


Please correct me If I am wrong.. I will close this jira..
fields.summary: Fix Typos in all the projects

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.body: Currently two issues I linked this jira...If anyone disagree this approach, I will close this parent jira ( spending time on this also might not good,,anyway I am thinking to assign to newbie's) ...waiting for someone give their opinion..
Here's a list of the spelling errors I've run across.  It's very likely that someone will have to merge several batches of such errors found.
Good collection...Thinking to raise separate issue for this and link to this issue..
[~jghoman] kindly review attached patch which contains bunch of typo's which is given by [~rchiang]....I will assigne this jira to him....

This message was automatically generated.

One other thing to be aware of.  The last time I tried submitting a bunch of typo fixes to multiple projects, I ran into Jenkins issues with HADOOP-11320.  It looks like the previous patch I submitted works okay (i.e. it gets a Jenkins update), but it could result in issues if this patch covers a lot of files.
Found some more typos.
